channel.title: Filipino :: Ray's Recipe's
channel.description: Foreword A collection of Filipino Recipe’s. Pork and Coconut, and intense savoury goodness are normal here! personally my favorite food with japanese Ginataang Ginataang Manok Adobo Fried BBQ

item.title: Ginataang Manok
item.description: Foreword This is the Recipe i use to make Ginataang Manok, also called a Chicken Coconut Stew. Tip Get some Nice fatty Coconut milk, i’d say around 40% upwards. This dish, as well as many other versions have alot of freedom! as long as the core ingridients are correct" Shopping list! Chicken Wings Coconut milk Onions, Potatos, Carrots (the veg) Garlic, Ginger and Vinegar (flavouring) A hearty Stew preprep: chop the veg roughly, the potatos and carrots rather big while the rest is roughly copped. 1st. add some oil and fry the onions, garlic and the ginger off, medium - high is good, until you can smell them. Tip i highly recommend to add Shrimp Paste. it just gives it so much more Umami

item.title: Lumpia Shanghai
item.description: Foreword This is the Recipe i use to make Lumpia Shanghai, Bascially the Filipino verion of Pork Spring Rolls. They are fairly simple to make, they just take time to prepare! this is for around 500g of meat. Shopping list! Pork Mince Spring Roll Wrappers Carrots n onions Oyster Sauce Egg’s (optional: Cashew Nuts) Making the filling 1st. Cut 1 Carrot and 1 Onions finely. or you can use a grater. 2nd. in a bowl add the Veg, 500g Pork mince, Potato or Corn Starch. 0.5 Tsb Coriander Powder. 1 Tsb Chicken Powder (or borth powder), 1 Tsb Garlic Powder, 1 Tsb Salt, 1 Tsb Pepper, 1 Tsb Sugar, 2 TBsp Oyster sauce, and finally 2 Eggs 3rd. Mix it until its all nice and combined 4th. Take a Wrapper and add around 1 TBsp of the mixture and roll it in. close the rolls with Water or egg wash if you feel fancy Details Fold the sides in, and then roll it downwards, make a “cigar”
